comment.author: 35094498@N00
comment._content: Those are haystacks, not corn shocks.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for your comment. I looked at the tiff image for the picture at : memory.loc.gov/master/pnp/fsac/1a33000/1a33800/1a33822u.tif It seems to show a cornfield and stacks of corn plants, so the caption is probably accurate.

comment.author: 7795396@N07
comment._content: Definitely that is a stack of maize plants. The cattle eat the dried leaves during winter. The type of agriculture practiced there in the 1940s is strikingly similar to that of Central Europe.

comment.author: 7211509@N04
comment._content: I've never seen these type of stacks.

comment.author: 8206259@N06
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Edible Chesapeake, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
